definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Your boss is so verbose, his speech should be concise and comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 你们老板也太罗嗦了，应该言简意赅一点。

sentences.english: None of that jello crap. Mama needs to get her buzz on.
sentences.chinese: 废话少说，妈妈得学会言简意赅了。

sentences.english: If need be, be mostly silent or speak sparingly.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要，最好保持静默或言简意赅。

sentences.english: The real thing in writing, concise and comprehensive word neat.
sentences.chinese: 写法真实事道破，言简意赅字利落。

definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
prologue of play/opening remarks/preamble (of speeches, articles etc)
